description.narrative: Poor women and men at risk of climate change hazards and disasters are informed and empowered to voice their concerns, needs and aspirations, as well as to make and negotiate appropriate decisions to protect their interests and livelihood. The project duration isfrom August 2013 to Mar 2016. Total approved budget of threes year is US$231,000. Approach The project works to achieve three specific outcomes: 1. Poor women and men, particularly ethnic minorities, have enhanced awareness and confidence toshape, claim and receive required information and services to adapt their crop calendar and farming system to consequences of climate change. 2. Provincial department of agriculture and rural development (DARD) and hydro-met stations have strong capacityto collect and analyze biological and meteorological data for crop-weather simulation and the development of agro-climatic forecasts 3. A farmers #customized agro-climate forecast and information system (between national and grass root levels) is institutionalized and presented in relevant workshops, networks for dissemination and advocacy. Target Groups Hai Phuc covers 3 villages: Ta Lang, Nam, and Van Van. It comprises 131 households (281 men and 291 women) . The large majority (94 households) belongto the Van Kieu ethnic group, while the others are Kinh people. Hai thanh covers 3 villages: Trung Don, Phuoc Dien and Kim Sanh. It comprises 525 households (1088 men and 1135 women). The entire population are Kinh people. Expected changes - 80% peoplein two communes aware the role of using agro-climate forecast bulletin in their cultivation - At least 70% communes in Dak Rong and Hai Lang district receive the bulletins with new template - Higher crop production and minimize the risk from disasterin the context of climate change - The good documentation on model implementation and circulate to relevant government agencies in Quang Tri province - Interest communes from other districts willing to buy theagro-climate forecast bulletin for theircommunes through the good impact evidences from piloted model
